intro: Baeria fremontii var. conjugens, commonly known as the Fremont's baeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest for botanists studying adaptive plant structures.
